product_name: Yellow Gold Shared-Prong Emerald Eternity Ring
overall_description: A sophisticated fine jewelry piece consisting of an 18k yellow gold band with a high-polish finish. The design features a partial eternity style setting with round brilliant-cut green gemstones (likely emeralds or tsavorites) secured in a shared-prong vertical gallery setting. The ring shank has a comfort-fit profile and features an internal engraving reading 'adhav'.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A high-quality macro product shot of an 18k yellow gold ring mounting without gemstones. The object is a single continuous metal piece consisting of a polished circular shank that transitions into a gallery of vertical prongs at the top. The setting area features a row of empty circular baskets with shared prongs designed to hold round stones. The metal has a luxurious mirror-like yellow gold finish with high reflectivity. The shank profile is half-round/comfort-fit. The geometry is precise and symmetrical.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Product photography, macro lens, studio lighting with softboxes, 3/4 perspective view, neutral mid-gray solid background (#808080), clean professional render, high resolution, sharp details, no shadows on background, physically based rendering
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: gemstones, diamonds, stones, transparent background, white background, black background, multiple objects, text, engraving, watermarks, blurry, low quality, distorted proportions, noise, grain
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: Isometric 3/4 view showing both the side profile and the top setting area
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Three-point studio lighting to accentuate the curvature of the gold and the depth of the empty prong settings

components.shape_description: Torus-like base transitioning into a linear array of U-shaped baskets/prongs
components.manufacturing_notes: Produced via lost-wax casting. The model requires support structures for the prongs during casting. Post-processing involves tumbling, sanding the sprue mark, and high-polishing before stone setting.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A single, exquisite round brilliant-cut emerald gemstone. The stone exhibits a deep, vibrant forest green color with characteristic translucency and crystalline depth. The geometry includes a flat top table, faceted crown, girdle, and a faceted pavilion coming to a point (culet) at the bottom. The surface has a vitreous luster, reflecting light with sharp specular highlights. The faceting pattern is precise and symmetrical.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Macro gem photography, studio lighting, 3/4 view angle showing crown and pavilion, neutral mid-gray solid background (#808080), clean professional render, high resolution, sharp details, no shadows on background, ray-traced refraction
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: metal, ring, jewelry, mounting, multiple stones, opaque, plastic looking, cartoonish, white background, black background, text, watermark
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: 3/4 view from slightly above to show table facet and depth of pavilion
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Backlighting to show translucency and green color, combined with front reflection mapping for facet definition

components.shape_description: Round Brilliant Cut (Cone shape bottom, domed faceted top)
components.position: Mounted within the prongs at the top of component 1
components.manufacturing_notes: Stones are sourced and sorted for color matching. Set manually by pushing the gold prongs of component 1 over the girdle of the stones.

additional_notes: The provided image shows the ring from a strict side profile, hiding the number of stones. For 3D reconstruction, assuming a standard 5-stone or 7-stone partial eternity layout is safest. The engraving 'adhav' is a laser marking applied post-finishing and does not need to be part of the physical geometry prompt for the casting.
